gurmukhi: dYq cly qij Kyq ieau jYsy bfy gun loB qy jwq prweI ]224]
transliteration: Dait Chale Taj(i) Khet Iu Jaise Bade Goun Lobh Te Jaat Paraaoo||224||
translation: Then the demons leaving the battlefield, ran away like the good qualities from the avarice.224.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI mwrkMfy purwny cMfI cirqRy suMB bDih nwm spqmo iDAwie sMpUrn ]7]
transliteration: It(i) Sroo Maarkande Puraane Channdoo Charitre Sounbh Badhah(i) Naam Saptamo Dhiaae Sanpooran||7||
translation: End of the Seventh Chapter entitled ‘Slaying of Sumbh’ in CHANDI CHARITRA of Markandeya Purana.7.

gurmukhi: Bwij gieE mGvw ijn ky fr bHm qy Awid sBY BYBIqy ]
transliteration: Bhaaj(i) Gado Maghvaa Jin Ke Dar Brahm Te Aadh Sabhai Bhaibhoote||
translation: With whose fear Indra had fied from heaven and Brahma and other gods, had been filled with fear.

gurmukhi: qyeI vY dYq prwie gey rn hwr inhwr Bey blu rIqy ]
transliteration: Teoo Vai Dait Paraae Gad Ran Haar Nihaar Bhae Bal(u) Roote||
translation: The same demons, seeing defeat in the battlefield, being devoid of their power had run away.

gurmukhi: jMbuk giRJ inrws Bey bnbws gey jug jwm n bIqy ]
transliteration: Janbouk Grijh Niraas Bhae Banbaas Gad Joug Jaam Na Boote||
translation: The jackals and vultures, having been dejected, have returned to the forest, even the two watches of the day have not elapsed.

gurmukhi: sMq shwie sdw jg mwie su sMB insuMB bfy Air jIqy ]225]
transliteration: Sant Sahaae Sadaa Jag Maae Su Sounbh Nisounbh Bade Ar(i) Jite||225||
translation: The mother of the world (goddess), ever the protector of saints, hath conquered the great enemies Sumbh and Nisumbh.225.

gurmukhi: dyv sBY imil kY iek Taur su A`Cq kuMkm cMdn lIno ]
transliteration: Dev Sabhai Mil(i) Kai Ik Thaur Su Achchhat Kounkam Channdan Loono||
translation: All the gods gathering at one place and taking rice, saffron and sandalwood.

gurmukhi: q`Cn l`Cn dY kY pRd`Cn tIkw su cMf ky Bwl mY dIno ]
transliteration: Tachchanndlachchannddai Kai Pradachchanndtookaa Su Channd Ke Dhaal Mai Doono||
translation: Lakhs of gods, circumambulating the goddess immeditately applied the frontal mark (of victory) on her forehead.

gurmukhi: qw Cib ko aupijE qh Bwv iehY kiv ny mn mY liK lIno ]
transliteration: Taa Chhab(i) Ko Oupjio Tah Bhaav Ihai Kav(i) Ne Man Mai Lakh(i) Loono||
translation: The glory of that event hath been imagined by the poet in his mind like this:

gurmukhi: mwnhu cMd ky mMfl mY suB mMgl Awn pÍysih kIno ]226]
transliteration: Maanoh Channd Ke Mandal Mai Soubh Mandal Aan Pravesah(i) Koono||226||
translation: It seemed that in the sphere of the moon, the period of “propitious rejoicings” hath penetrated. 226.

gurmukhi: imil kY su dyvn bfweI krI kwlkw kI eyho jgmwq qYN qo kitE bfo pwp hY ]
transliteration: Mil(i) Kais U Devan Badaaoo Daroo Kaalkaa Koo Eho Jagmaat Tain To Katio Bado Paap Hai||
translation: All the gods gathered and sang this Eulogy in praise of the goddess: “O Universal mother, Thou hast effaced a very great sin;

gurmukhi: dYqn ko mwr rwj dIno qY surys hUM ko bfo jsu lIno jg qyro eI pRqwpu hY ]
transliteration: Daitan Ko Maar Raaj Doono Tai Sures Hoon Ko Bado Jas(u) Loono Jag Tero Ee Prataap Hai||
translation: “Thou hast bestowed on Indra the kingdom of heaven by killing the demons, Thou hast earned great repulations and Thy glory hath spread in the world.
